title: What to Wear to a Celebration of Life (and What to Avoid)

steps.title: Mid-length dress and heels.
steps.content: Mid-length dress and heels. Opt for semi-formal attire if the celebration of life is at a more formal venue, such as an upscale restaurant or a place of worship. For example, you could wear a navy blue or maroon dress with matching heels and a tasteful necklace. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Slacks, button-down, and flats.
steps.content: Slacks, button-down, and flats. Keep your attire more conservative when attending a celebration of life held at a reception hall or event space. Try a clean button-down in a neutral or subtle color with black, gray, or khaki slacks. Accessorize with simple jewelry and a pop of color.

steps.title: Colorful skirt, blouse, and flats.
steps.content: Colorful skirt, blouse, and flats. Dress comfortably and more casually for a celebration of life held at a family member’s home. Pair a patterned skirt in light pinks, reds, greens, or yellows with a matching blouse and neutral flats.

steps.title: Jeans, blouse, and flats.
steps.content: Jeans, blouse, and flats. Go for a more casual look if the celebration of life is held outdoors. For example, try a pair of dark-wash jeans and a blouse in a colorful solid or print. A nice, structured t-shirt and clean, stylish sneakers are also acceptable. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Sundress and sneakers.
steps.content: Sundress and sneakers. The celebration of life may be held at the beach or require you to take part in outdoor activities. Keep your outfit comfortable, stylish, and respectful with a mid-length sundress in a colorful floral or solid print and clean, white sneakers. [3] X Research source Long shorts and a colorful solid or patterned structured t-shirt is another great casual option.

steps.title: Slacks, button-down, and dress shoes.
steps.content: Slacks, button-down, and dress shoes. Keep your outfit classic and conservative for a celebration of life held at a formal venue. Try a pastel-colored button-down, a pair of slacks in black, gray, or khaki, and neutral dress shoes. Add a pop of color in your accessories, such as a tie or pocket square. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Dark trousers, button-down, and boots.
steps.content: Dark trousers, button-down, and boots. Aim for a balance of casual and put together for a slightly less formal celebration of life. For example, wear a pair of nice trousers in black, gray, or brown with a button-down in light blue, green, purple, or pink. Finish the look off with a nice pair of black or brown boots. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Chinos, collared shirt, and boots.
steps.content: Chinos, collared shirt, and boots. Choose a more relaxed outfit when you attend a celebration of life at a luncheon or home gathering. Opt for a colorful shirt with a pair of white, light gray, or khaki chinos during the spring and summer and black, navy blue, or maroon chinos during the fall and winter. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Jeans, polo shirt, and sneakers.
steps.content: Jeans, polo shirt, and sneakers. Keep your outfit casual and comfortable for a celebration of life outdoors. Wear a nice pair of jeans and a polo in a bright color or print with clean, stylish sneakers due to the more relaxed atmosphere. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Distracting colors or prints.
steps.content: Distracting colors or prints. Keep the attention away from yourself and towards the celebration of life. Avoid neon colors, loud prints, and overly sparkly or distracting clothes and accessories. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Revealing clothes.
steps.content: Revealing clothes. Keep your outfit on the conservative side. While a celebration of life is more casual than a funeral, you still need to be respectful of the loved one’s family. Choose dresses and skirts that fall at the knee or below, avoid plunging necklines, and keep button-down shirts buttoned. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Graphic t-shirts.
steps.content: Graphic t-shirts. Even though a celebration of life can be a laid-back event, avoid being distracting and overly casual by wearing a graphic t-shirt. Instead, wear a nice, structured t-shirt in a solid color or striped print. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Flip-flops and sandals.
steps.content: Flip-flops and sandals. Wear conservative, closed-toe shoes to remain respectful of the event and appear put together. Stick to low heels, flats, dress shoes, and nice boots for a more formal celebration of life. Even if the event is very casual, stick to a pair of clean sneakers or loafers. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Dress for the location and venue.
steps.content: Dress for the location and venue. Take into account what you would normally wear when going to an event where the celebration of life is held. If the celebration of life is at a church or restaurant, dress formally but with style. Choose a pair of jeans and a nice t-shirt if the celebration of life is an outdoor get-together. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Follow the dress code.
steps.content: Follow the dress code. Many families honor their loved one’s life by asking that you dress in their loved one’s favorite color. If the loved one was known for their style, the family may ask you to be flashy and fashionable. You may also be asked to dress for a theme, such as wearing the jerseys of your loved one’s favorite sports team. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Plan for activities.
steps.content: Plan for activities. Wear clothes that allow you to participate in the events scheduled for the celebration of life. If you are walking or hiking to celebrate your loved one’s love of the outdoors, wear athletic shoes or hiking boots. Accessorize appropriately for the activities too, such as wearing a hat to a beach celebration of life. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Understand the tone of the event.
steps.content: Understand the tone of the event. The loved one’s family members will set the tone of the celebration of life, so follow cues on whether the event is more festive or relaxed. The celebration of life may be a beach bonfire, where you can wear a Hawaiian shirt and shorts, or a religious service where you should dress more conservatively. [15] X Research source The celebration of life may follow the loved one’s religious or cultural customs that are more celebratory or formal. Dress respectfully and only wear clothing that is religious or cultural if you are asked. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Keep the time of day in mind.
steps.content: Keep the time of day in mind. Evening events are typically more formal and daytime events are more casual. There are always exceptions, such as if the celebration of life is a nighttime gathering at the loved one’s favorite bar or at an afternoon religious service. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Check the weather.
steps.content: Check the weather. During the cooler months, add a blazer or cashmere sweater for a formal event or a jacket and flannel shirt for a more casual get-together. When it’s warmer, wear linen pants or a flowy dress with a light sweater for a more formal event or keep it casual in light jeans or long shorts and a nice t-shirt. [18] X Research source
